page.title: 11Occold School
page.content: The school was built in 1879 on a patch of land called Glebe belonging to the church.The school used to be a church school run by the church until it became a council school and then known as Occold County Primary School taken over by the East Suffolk County Council.If the land it stands on was not sold with the school it must be the only piece of Glebe land left in the parish.An old school stood there before this one was built but it was a big thatched building or perhaps an old house.120 children from Occold and Rishangles attended the school when it was first built. The school today is very different.Since then toilets have been installed,electric lighting has been put in,we have a TV,computer,sinks drinking fountain and modern furniture.
